column4: Hey guys Ubuntu is starting to get extremely slow and lag and I think its time for a fresh install, right now im backing everything up to a seperate partition but I just want to know, are there any distro's that are really customizable and a little more advanced than ubuntu?
there are many
for ultimate customization, try gentoo.
is it more of a terminal line distro or does it have graphics?
terminal of course
does the name not give it away?
someone already answered you
I dont notice unless someone actually mentions my name
man rsync
rm
what do you mean what type
what cpu is it
grep name /proc/cpuinfo
you might want to check out abcde, it's a very nice ripper
Can it rip automatically when cds are inserted? and can it go online and give the tracks metadata?
it can automatically rip and grab track tags from the internet and tag them
you can configure nautilus to run it when a cd is inserted
Oh alright so it doesnt require any user interaction? im making a htpc
you can set it to not require any, yes, but i would check to make sure the tags are correct (through ssh maybe since it's a htpc)
Ill check on it once in awhile
32bit
what type though?like architecture
